sn35.93:4.1: “Mendicants, consciousness exists dependent on a duality.
sn35.93:4.3: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn35.93:4.4: The eye is impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.5: Sights are impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.6: So this duality is tottering and toppling; it’s impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.7: Eye consciousness is impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.8: And the causes and conditions that give rise to eye consciousness are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.9: But since eye consciousness has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?
sn35.93:4.10: The meeting, coming together, and joining together of these three things is called eye contact.
sn35.93:4.11: Eye contact is also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.12: And the causes and conditions that give rise to eye contact are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:4.13: But since eye contact has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?
sn35.93:4.14: Contacted, one feels, intends, and perceives.
sn35.93:4.15: So these things are tottering and toppling; they’re impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:5.8: The meeting, coming together, and joining together of these three things is called tongue contact.
sn35.93:6.1: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn35.93:6.2: The mind is impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.3: Phenomena are impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.4: So this duality is tottering and toppling; it’s impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.5: Mind consciousness is impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.6: And the causes and conditions that give rise to mind consciousness are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.7: But since mind consciousness has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?
sn35.93:6.8: The meeting, coming together, and joining together of these three things is called mind contact.
sn35.93:6.9: Mind contact is also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.10: And the causes and conditions that give rise to mind consciousness are also impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.11: But since mind contact has arisen dependent on conditions that are impermanent, how could it be permanent?
sn35.93:6.12: Contacted, one feels, intends, and perceives.
sn35.93:6.13: So these things are tottering and toppling; they’re impermanent, perishing, and changing.
sn35.93:6.14: This is how consciousness exists dependent on a duality.”
